subject: Negotiation
title: The Asch Conformity Experiment
description: A quick, practical guide to The Asch Conformity Experiment.

hook.text: 75% of people gave an obviously wrong answer just because everyone else in the room did.

buildup.text: Solomon Asch showed participants a line and asked which comparison line matched. The answer was obvious.

discovery.text: But when planted actors all chose the wrong answer, 75% of subjects conformed at least once.

twist.text: Even one dissenter in the group reduced conformity by 80% â€” a single voice of truth breaks the spell.

climax.text: In group negotiations, be the dissenter when needed. One honest voice changes the entire dynamic.

punchline.text: It only takes one person to break a room full of conformity.

quiz.question: What reduced conformity most in Asch's experiment?
options: Having even one person dissent from the majority
